Provide build ID and test case to give us chance to reproduce it, thanks
Move to JDT/UI for further investigation (note that ExtractInterfaceUtil does no
longer exist in 3.1 and ExtractInterfaceRefactoring as now 72 lines, so it seems
that it was a old version which was used for this bug...)

Eclipse Platform

Version: 3.1.0
Build id: 200412162000


The class on which i was performing the extract interface, was an abstract class
extending another abstract class. The abstract super class implemented an interface.

I had checked "Change references to the <Class> into references to the interface
<interface.' check box. When I unchecked it, the refactoring went through. But I
had to manually replace the references to the abstract class.
Tobias, can you please have a look.

The class ExtractInterfaceUtil does not exist in R 3.1 anymore, since the 
refactoring has been completely rewritten.

Guessing from the build ID you are using an old 3.1 integration build.
